DH285.name: Introduction to Digital Humanities
DH285.description: Critical technology theory and practice. Critique and analysis of technology. Production and creativity with digital tools.

DH340.name: Digital Humanities Seminar
DH340.description: Digital humanities issues and research explored from a variety of humanities-based perspectives.
DH340.prerequisite: (DH 285 or approval of college) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

DH480.name: Digital Humanities Portfolio Workshop
DH480.description: Workshop covering key topics and approaches in digital humanities, preparing professional portfolios in print and digital formats, including application materials for career, graduate study, and professional positions.
DH480.prerequisite: ((DH 285 and DH 340) and completion of Tier I writing requirement) and ((DH 491 or concurrently) or (DH 493 or concurrently))
DH480.restrictions: Open to seniors. Approval of college.

DH490.name: Digital Humanities Independent Study
DH490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
DH490.description: Special project, directed reading and research arranged by an undergraduate student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

DH491.name: Special Topics in Digital Humanities
DH491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
DH491.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty on group study basis.

DH493.name: Digital Humanities Internship
DH493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
DH493.description: Supervised preprofessional field experience in digital humanities.
DH493.prerequisite: (DH 285) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

DH861.name: Digital Humanities Pedagogy
DH861.description: Teaching with digital tools, technologies, and spaces in the humanities. Key concepts, issues, and approaches for digital pedagogy in different course spaces (physical, digital). Course planning, curricular development, engagement and learning, and evaluation and assessment related to digital humanities pedagogy. Methods for research and scholarship on digital humanities pedagogy (teacher scholarship).

DH863.name: Digital Humanities Research
DH863.description: Methodological and theoretical approaches for digital humanities research. Ethical issues and human subjects considerations. Analysis and application of qualitative and quantitative methods, including data analysis, and database creation and management, social media analyses, visualization projects, and geospatial mapping.

DH865.name: Digital Humanities Methods Seminar
DH865.description: Brainstorming, creating, and managing digital humanities research projects. Selecting appropriate methodologies, methods, and tools for digital humanities research. Applying project management tools. Seeking funding and support for digital humanities research projects.

DH890.name: Digital Humanities Independent Study
DH890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
DH890.description: Special project, directed reading, and research arranged by a graduate student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

DH891.name: Special Topics in Digital Humanities
DH891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
DH891.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty on group study basis.

DH893.name: Digital Humanities Internship
DH893.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
